summary: Millions of Medicaid beneficiaries rely on personal care services for help with daily tasks like bathing and eating. However, these types of services are at high risk for fraud and abuse—e.g., services that were paid for but never provided. We found that the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services needs better data to oversee these personal care services. In 2012, for example, $4.9 billion worth...
title: Medicaid: CMS Needs Better Data to Monitor the Provision of and Spending on Personal Care Services
